title: Australians to experience more 50C days as heatwaves intensify, experts say | ABC NEWS
description: Australians should brace for longer and more frequent heatwaves, with climate scientists warning that 50-degree days are now a permanent reality. This year's extreme temperatures have broken records in three states, signalling a shift towards what was once a rare event.  ABC meteorologist Dr Adam Morgan explores the implications of these 50-degree summers for Australia. description: The UK Prime Minister has called for Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor to testify before US Congress about his ties to Jeffrey Epstein. title: Israel kills at least 30 Palestinians including children in heaviest strikes in weeks | ABC NEWS
description: At least 30 people have been killed in Gaza as Israel carried out its heaviest air strikes in weeks, according to local authorities. The strikes occurred one day after Israel accused Hamas of new ceasefire violations and a day before the Rafah crossing along the border with Egypt is set to open. Gaza's Health Ministry has recorded 509 Palestinians killed by Israeli fire since the start of the ceasefire on October 10, 2025. title: Nationals leader David Littleproud to face leadership spill | ABC NEWS
description: Nationals leader David Littleproud will face his first leadership challenge tomorrow in Canberra. Queensland MP Colin Boyce is attempting to unseat him, though his success is unlikely. Meanwhile, Sussan Ley's leadership of the Liberal Party is also under threat. title: Epstein files: Democrats accuse DOJ of a cover-up, call for unredacted documents | ABC NEWS
description: Democrats are demanding to see recently released Epstein files unredacted, accusing the Department of Justice of a cover-up after details emerged of authorities' plan to charge three other suspected co-conspirators in the late convicted sex trafficker’s network.  Many high-profile figures mentioned in the documents include Bill Gates, Donald Trump, Bill Clinton and Steve Bannon, but mentions do not suggest criminal wrongdoing. Meanwhile, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is urging former prince Andrew to testify in front of the US congress as his name appears numerous times in the documents and a second woman made allegations of sexual abuse against him. title: The problem with Tyra Banks's 'Hot Ice Cream' | ABC NEWS
description: Tyra Banks' "hot ice cream" went viral, but don't expect to see it called that anymore.  In a statement to ABC News, the store said it decided to "transition the product name" to "lean further into our brand voice". "Much of our customers’ conversation centered on the experience itself and on playful references to 'smizing' (smiling with your eyes)," the company said. "SMiZE & DREAM takes food labelling and marketing obligations seriously and have worked with advisors to ensure our customer facing information is clear and accurate." title: Search for missing swimmer at Maroubra complicated by rough seas | ABC NEWS
description: A multi-agency search has resumed for a man in his 30s who went missing while swimming off Sydney's Maroubra beach on Sunday. Choppy seas and high winds are complicating search efforts, with Marine Rescue boats, surf lifesaving jetskis and the Westpac search helicopter scouring the water. There is a hazardous surf warning for coastal NSW and Maroubra has been closed to swimmers. title: What China’s military turmoil means for Taiwan | ABC News Daily podcast
description: There’s turmoil at the top of the Chinese military with President Xi Jinping removing some of his most experienced generals.    He sacked two key figures, accusing them of corruption, raising questions about the timeline for his ambition to take over Taiwan.    Today, China expert Neil Thomas from the Asia Society Policy Institute on what Xi Jinping is up to.    Featured:    Neil Thomas, fellow on Chinese Politics at the Center for China Analysis at the Asia Society Policy Institute in Washington DC

title: Small number of Palestinians to be allowed to leave Gaza for first time in two years | ABC NEWS
description: The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt is set to open to allow two-way traffic for the first time in nearly two years.  The step is an important part of a peace process brokered by US President Donald Trump. Humanitarian organisations are labelling the move only as symbolic because Israeli authorities are only allowing up to 150 people to leave per day to seek medical treatment across the border, as UNRWA director of affairs Sam Rose says there is a large backlog of patients requiring urgent treatment. title: Russia strikes mine workers, maternity hospital in Ukraine | ABC NEWS
description: At least 12 Ukrainian mine workers have been killed after their bus was targeted by a Russian drone strike in the Dnipropetrovsk region. Meanwhile, a separate strike on a maternity hospital in Zaporizhzhia wounded nine. title: Gold and silver crash in price after precious metal mania | ABC NEWS
description: The price of silver plunged 30 per cent over the weekend, with gold also diving. Kyle Rodda says the 'once in a generation' drops come after an excess in speculative positions building in the market collided with Donald Trump's relatively independent nominee for chair of the Federal Reserve. title: IN FULL: Police 'strongly believe' Dezi Freeman is dead as new search launched | ABC NEWS
description: Victoria police say they ‘strongly believe’  fugitive Dezi Freeman is dead five months after a deadly police shooting at a property in Porepunkah. Authorities have launched a fresh five-day search in Mount Buffalo National Park. Freeman allegedly shot Detective Leading Senior Constable Neal Thompson and Senior Constable Vadim de Waart-Hottart dead at his property on Rayner Track. title: Housing market to slow with interest rate rises likely, expert says | ABC NEWS
description: Property prices are rising nationwide, with Cotality's house price index up 0.8 per cent in January. However, annual growth is expected to slow.  Nerida Conisbee, Chief Economist at Ray White, forecasts a market slowdown this year though does not expect prices falls.
